comment: bro is super chill, gives you a wide range of creative freedom on your projects, and cares about you and your art but is laid back at the same time. if you can get him for a class, DO IT AT ALL COSTS. might be the best drawing teacher at ksu

This is the most creative freedom Ive had in an art class, only 1 still life, a couple of in class critiques, and a lot of creative freedom with little to no rules on mediums(not paint), concepts, ideas, etc. There will be a good chunk of time to dedicate outside of class later in the semester but hes overall chill and straightforward.

Two homework assignments. The 6 projects you can do in class, he even lets you leave early and work on it home if you want. Took the 6:30pm class and there were 9 people in the class. It feels like you are chilling all class, he barely talks. He is very helpful if you ask, but other than that he just lets you have free range. Great guy

Took him for figure drawing and although he's a chill cool dude that teaches a bit, he wasn't challenging. He listens to students ideas for projects especially for animation majors. He is a very mellow person. You could afford to miss a class or two but don't do it too often. He also only likes to be contacted through text.
Goldman was one of the best professors I've ever had. His class was both relaxing and hilarious and I wish drawing 2 was required for my major so I could take him again.
Great professor who really lets you explore art and gives decent feed back. Overall good guy too. Easy to talk to and very understanding. HIGHLY recommend for drawing 2 courses. Awesome class.

Professor G is super chill and is always saying something funny. He gives good feedback and lets you take work home to get a higher grades. Come to class because he does live demos and is willing to help with anything plus you get breaks and can leave whenever youre done. Loved his class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Professor Goldman was really easy. He said as long as you don't miss 3 or more classes, you'll get a good grade. He never gave me anything below an A in my class. I didn't try very hard on one of my assignments (something personal happened), but he was understanding that sometimes life happens and you can't always have good art days.

Honestly just take him. He gives you good feedback, workload isn't too heavy, his teachings are clear, and is always there is you need help. I ended with a B and I can admit myself, I was not the most dedicated in the class by far. But don't think his class is straight juice either. He is just a very solid professor and have no complaints for him
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Take Goldman. It's that simple. Super layed back and let's you revise your drawings after turning it in to get a better grade. Class is chill and he's hilarious. Best professor I've ever had.
If you're taking drawing you want Mr. Goldman. He's hilarious, gives breaks, and very relaxed. By far my favorite art professor so far.
I love Goldman! He makes the class very chill, so it is very stress free when you're working on projects. He's also very helpful when you need help or have questions.

Goldman is a great guy, but he really isn't helpful for Advanced Painting. He just let us do whatever we wanted and didn't really grade or give feedback. Said he was going to give everyone an A because it was a summer course, so I worked hard for nothing. Also, don't take advanced painting as a summer course, you don't have enough time really.

A laid back professor, gives fun assignments, but forgets to put the assignment outline online. He forgets to respond to emails so if you have a question, its best to ask in person. He's nice and lets you edit your art piece after critique for a try at a higher grade.

Ben is the most relaxed art teacher i've ever had. He lets you do your own thing, but if you need help he is happy to help. He has a sense of humor and doesn't care. Only complaint would be that he didn't post grades until last minute or have a schedule of assignts. We do class critiques after every project and he isn't very strict on the due dates

Awesome professor. He is really funny and easy to talk to. Gives great feedback and lets you edit your artwork after critiques. Just an all around cool guy. I would definitely take this professor again.

My facorite teacher by far that I have ever had in art. I'm an art major and I really loved this class compared to others I've taken because mr Ben just made it great. Super nice and motivational and helpful. Will be taking him again

I LOVE MR. BEN! He is so laid back!  I literally knew NOTHING about drawing nor did I know anything about art and he was beyond patient with me and wasn't as harsh on me because I truly have no background in art. I say, TAKE HIS CLASS! I'm not sure if you'll be a better artist from it (I still can't draw) but I definitely say his class was worth it

Ben is the best. The class is so relaxed but fun, but that doesn't mean it's an easy A. He's not going to fail you as long as you show up and put in some effort, but you have to work for an A. He takes attendance but loosely and you can only miss 3 classes without counting against you. Overall, I loved being in his class and I learned a lot.

He is one of the best professors! Extremely helpful, very laid back. He keeps repeating:" drawing makes you a better person". Isn't that enough? Amazing atmosphere! He also knows a lot  and not only teach you how to draw better but gives also great advices for life as well. Take him, without a doubt.
Layed-back, but knows what he's talking about. Don't let his chill attitude fool you; You will still have to work to earn an A. Cool guy
Very chillax, easy-going professor. Helpful and gives good advice. Doesn't readily give out A's, but if you do the work and put effort into the assignments, it's an easy class!

Took him for Drawing I and was pleasantly surprised by the class. He's funny and nice, and is very fair with grading, though he doesn't give out A's easily. But he is very helpful and easy to talk to. If you're not getting his general examples, just ask for some one-on-one time and he really helps. Takes attendance according to KSU rules.
